verses.kjv: And Solomon the son of David was strengthened in his kingdom, and the LORD his God was with him, and magnified him exceedingly.
verses.ct: Solomon son of David established firm control over his kingdom. The LORD his God was with him and made him extremely great.

verses.kjv: Then Solomon spake unto all Israel, to the captains of thousands and of hundreds, and to the judges, and to every governor in all Israel, the chief of the fathers.
verses.ct: Solomon addressed all of Israel — the commanders of thousands and of hundreds, the judges, and every leader throughout Israel, including the heads of families.

verses.kjv: So Solomon, and all the congregation with him, went to the high place that was at Gibeon; for there was the tabernacle of the congregation of God, which Moses the servant of the LORD had made in the wilderness.
verses.ct: Then Solomon and the entire assembly with him traveled to the worship site at Gibeon, because that was where God's tent of meeting stood — the one that Moses, the LORD's servant, had constructed in the wilderness.

verses.kjv: But the ark of God had David brought up from Kirjathjearim to the place which David had prepared for it: for he had pitched a tent for it at Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Now David had already moved the ark of God from Kirjathjearim to the location he had prepared for it, since he had set up a tent for it in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: Moreover the brasen altar, that Bezaleel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, had made, he put before the tabernacle of the LORD: and Solomon and the congregation sought unto it.
verses.ct: Also, the bronze altar that Bezaleel son of Uri, son of Hur, had crafted was there in front of the LORD's tabernacle. Solomon and the assembly came to worship there.

verses.kjv: And Solomon went up thither to the brasen altar before the LORD, which was at the tabernacle of the congregation, and offered a thousand burnt offerings upon it.
verses.ct: Solomon approached the bronze altar in the LORD's presence at the tent of meeting and presented 1,000 burnt offerings on it.

verses.kjv: In that night did God appear unto Solomon, and said unto him, Ask what I shall give thee.
verses.ct: That night God appeared to Solomon and told him, "Ask for whatever you want me to give you."

verses.kjv: And Solomon said unto God, Thou hast shewed great mercy unto David my father, and hast made me to reign in his stead.
verses.ct: Solomon replied to God, "You showed tremendous mercy to my father David, and you have placed me on the throne in his place.

verses.kjv: Now, O LORD God, let thy promise unto David my father be established: for thou hast made me king over a people like the dust of the earth in multitude.
verses.ct: Now, LORD God, let your promise to my father David be fulfilled, because you have made me king over a people as numerous as the dust of the earth.

verses.kjv: Give me now wisdom and knowledge, that I may go out and come in before this people: for who can judge this thy people, that is so great?
verses.ct: Give me wisdom and knowledge so that I can lead this people properly, because who could possibly govern this great people of yours?"

verses.kjv: And God said to Solomon, Because this was in thine heart, and thou hast not asked riches, wealth, or honour, nor the life of thine enemies, neither yet hast asked long life; but hast asked wisdom and knowledge for thyself, that thou mayest judge my people, over whom I have made thee king:
verses.ct: God responded to Solomon, "Because this is what your heart desired — you didn't ask for riches, wealth, or honor, or for the death of your enemies, and you didn't even ask for a long life — but instead you asked for wisdom and knowledge to govern my people, over whom I have made you king —

verses.kjv: Wisdom and knowledge is granted unto thee; and I will give thee riches, and wealth, and honour, such as none of the kings have had that have been before thee, neither shall there any after thee have the like.
verses.ct: wisdom and knowledge are granted to you. Beyond that, I will also give you riches, wealth, and honor unlike anything the kings before you ever had, and no king after you will match it either."

verses.kjv: Then Solomon came from his journey to the high place that was at Gibeon to Jerusalem, from before the tabernacle of the congregation, and reigned over Israel.
verses.ct: Then Solomon returned to Jerusalem from the worship site at Gibeon, from the tent of meeting, and he ruled over Israel.

verses.kjv: And Solomon gathered chariots and horsemen: and he had a thousand and four hundred chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen, which he placed in the chariot cities, and with the king at Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Solomon accumulated chariots and horsemen. He had 1,400 chariots and 12,000 horsemen, which he stationed in the chariot cities and with him in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And the king made silver and gold at Jerusalem as plenteous as stones, and cedar trees made he as the sycomore trees that are in the vale for abundance.
verses.ct: The king made silver and gold as common in Jerusalem as stones, and cedar wood as plentiful as the sycamore trees in the foothills.

verses.kjv: And Solomon had horses brought out of Egypt, and linen yarn: the king’s merchants received the linen yarn at a price.
verses.ct: Solomon's horses were imported from Egypt, and his merchants purchased them in bundles at the going rate.

verses.kjv: And they fetched up, and brought forth out of Egypt a chariot for six hundred shekels of silver, and an horse for an hundred and fifty: and so brought they out horses for all the kings of the Hittites, and for the kings of Syria, by their means.
verses.ct: They imported a chariot from Egypt for 600 shekels of silver and a horse for 150 shekels. They also exported them to all the Hittite kings and the kings of Aram through these same traders.
